page.title: 19FLORA AND FAUNA OF AREA
page.content: Large areas of our fields are left as natural meadows with a few small areas of woodland. Trees around fields and lanes are Ash and Sycamore with Oak and other trees in plantations or old woods. Hedges are of Hawthorn, Hazel and Holly. Animals found in the area are Roe deer, foxes, badgers, hares and all the usual small mammals. There is a full range of wild birds from a wren to a buzzard. Large areas of derelict quarry allow many butterflies to breed like Marbled Whites and Small Blues. A wide variety of wild flowers are to be found in the hedgerows, fields and walls including Early Purple Orchids, Ragged Robin, Scabious, Violets, Oxlip, Primrose, many wild herbs, Stitchwort, Shining Cranesbill, Rough Hawksbeard, St.Johns Wort, beds of wild strawberries, Speedwell and Herb Robert.
